description: Liverpool reject two bids for Ben Doak, Arsenal want Matheus Cunha, Manchester City eye Lens defender Abdukodir Khusanov, plus more.
title: Football gossip: Doak, Cunha, Chukwuemeka, Lewis-Potter
title_page: Football gossip: Doak, Cunha, Chukwuemeka, Lewis-Potter - BBC Sport
maintext:
Liverpool reject bids from two Premier League clubs, Manchester City target a Ligue 1 defender and Arsenal want Wolves' in-form striker.
Manchester City have entered the race for Lens' 20-year-old Uzbekistan defender Abdukodir Khusanov. (Telegraph - subscription required), external
Liverpool have rejected a £15m bid from Crystal Palace for Ben Doak. The 19-year-old Scotland midfielder is on loan at Middlesbrough. (Times - subscription required), external
The Reds have also rejected a £16m bid from Ipswich for Doak and would prefer him to stay at Middlesbrough until the end of the season. (Athletic - subscription required), external
Liverpool want £30m if they are to sell teenager Doak. (Independent), external
Arsenal are exploring a January move for Wolves' Brazil striker Matheus Cunha, 25. (Football Insider), external
Wolves are working on a new contract for Cunha to try to keep him at the club. (Mail), external
Crystal Palace have had a £12.4m bid for Slavia Prague's 20-year-old Senegal full-back El Hadji Malick Diouf rejected. (Foot Mercato), external
Napoli have expressed an interest in signing Chelsea's 18-year-old English winger Carney Chukwuemeka, who is valued at about £30m. (Teamtalk), external
Saudi Pro League club Al-Shabab are confident of agreeing a deal for Wolves' 31-year-old Gabon midfielder Mario Lemina. (Rudy Galetti), external
Newcastle are set to record a profit for the first time in five years but still have to sell before they can buy this month if they are to comply with Premier League financial rules. (The i - subscription required) , external
Wolves hope to complete the £15m signing of Reims' 27-year-old Ivory Coast centre-back Emmanuel Agbadou early next week. (Telegraph), external
Brentford's 23-year-old English winger Keane Lewis-Potter is close to agreeing a new contract. (Athletic - subscription required), external
Turkish club Trabzonspor want Southampton striker Paul Onuachu but are only willing to pay £4.2m. The Saints want £8.3m for the 30-year-old Nigerian. (61medya - in Turkish), external
St Johnstone want to sign Liverpool and Scotland right-back Calvin Ramsay, 21, on loan after his loan spell at Wigan was cut short. (Courier), external
